articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: Woman takes toddler, puppy on high-speed chase that ends in fiery crash — and a rescue, cops say
articles.description: In Charleston County, South Carolina, a woman ignored deputies and led a high-speed chase before losing control and crashing into trees in McClellanville in a fiery wreck where her passenger, a toddler and a puppy had to be rescued, the Sheriff's Office said.

articles.author: By Noah Feit and John Monk nfeit@thestate.com jmonk@thestate.com
articles.title: Sister of Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof made threat, had weapon at AC Flora
articles.description: Morgan Roof, the younger sister of convicted Charleston church shooter Dylann Roof, was arrested for making a violent threat against students at AC Flora High School, according to the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: College baseball player is accused of raping woman who said he was a brother figure, police say
articles.description: A Charleston Southern baseball player was arrested and charged with first-degree criminal sexual conduct, according to the North Charleston Police Department, which said the pitcher raped a woman at his off-campus apartment after a night out drinking.

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: His wife died Tuesday, but Lexington doctor was charged in another death days later, coroner says
articles.description: The wife of Dr. Adam Lazzarini, who works for Lexington Medical Center, was found dead in her Cayce home May 1, 2018. On May 3, Lazzarini was charged in the fatal shooting of a Columbia, SC salesman at the same residence, according to the coroner.

articles.author: By Stephanie Jadrnicek Special to the Fort Mill Times
articles.title: In South Carolina, losing voting rights after a felony conviction not a life sentence
articles.description: Did you know? South Carolina is one of 21 states which allows former felons to restore their voting rights after serving their entire sentence, including parole and/or probation. The League of Women Voters in Charleston is trying to spread the word to encoura…

articles.author: By Noah Feit nfeit@thestate.com
articles.title: He gave his 89-year-old neighbor a drug-laced brownie — then robbed her, police say
articles.description: A South Carolina teenager was arrested and charged after he laced a brownie with drugs and gave it to his 89-year-old neighbor before robbing her home, according to authorities. Christian … Click to Continue »

articles.author: By Jared Gilmour jgilmour@mcclatchy.com
articles.title: Missing bus turned up in the woods. A fugitive, meth and spray paint cans were inside, S.C. cops say
articles.description: Apparently a coat of blue paint isn't the most effective disguise for a stolen school bus. Deputies arrested a fugitive on Thursday in Ladson, South Carolina, after they discovered him … Click to Continue »
